member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value of the property

member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.GetValueOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback that will be invoked before looking up the value of a DependencyProperty.
member.remarks: If this member is specified the DepenendencyObject will not attempt to get the value of the DependencyProperty specified in the GetValue method from its local cache. The called function can make a call to GetValueBase to retrieve the property value from the local cache.

member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.SetValueOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback that will be invoked before setting the value of a DependencyProperty.
member.remarks: If this member is specified the DepenendencyObject will not attempt to write the value specified in the SetValue method to its local cache. The called function can make a call to SetValueBase to store the property value in the local cache.

member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.PropertyInvalidatedCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback that will be invoked when the DependencyProperty is changed.

member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.ReadLocalValueOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback that will be invoked when a value is read from the local cache

member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.WriteLocalValueOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback that will be invoked when a value is written to the local cache

member.name: P:SnapStream.PropertyMetadata.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the DependencyProperty is readonly

member.name: T:SnapStream.DependencyObject
member.summary: DependencyObject allows arbitrary strongly typed data to be associated with any object that derives from it. This allows an object to set properties on another object for its own use.
member.remarks: DependencyObject allows a loose coupling to exist between components that would otherwise be difficult to achieve or type/implementation specific.

member.name: F:SnapStream.DependencyObject.EmptyValue
member.summary: Represents a value that that was cleared.

member.summary: Removes a property from this object.
member.remarks: After removing a property the default value for that property will always be returned.
member.param: The DependencyProperty to clear

member.param: The property whose value should be returned
member.returns: The value of the property

member.summary: Retrieves the value of the specified property.

member.param: The property whose value should be returned
member.returns: The value of the property

The value to set the DependencyProperty to

member.name: T:SnapStream.ValidateValueCallback
member.summary: Represents the method that will implement the ValidateValueCallback callback of DependencyProperty

member.name: T:SnapStream.DependencyProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty provides a mechanism for associating arbitrary data with a DependencyObject.
member.remarks: A DependencyProperty is a singleton object with respect to the property's name and owner type which means that any given type can only register one DependencyProperty with a given name. Several common services can be built on top of the infrastructure provided by DependencyProperty such as data binding and state invalidation. It is up to the consumers of DependencyProperty to implement these services.

member.name: M:SnapStream.DependencyProperty.FromName(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Finds a given DependencyProperty given it's name and the type of the owner
member.param: The name of the property
The type that owns the property
member.returns: The property if it exists

member.name: M:SnapStream.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers an attached property.
member.remarks: In order for attached properties to be found by the parser the type must declare a public static method that has the form void Set{name}( DependencyObject, {propertyType} ) and {propertyType} Get{name}( DependencyObject ). If these are not provided DependencyObject.SetValue or DependencyObject.GetValue are used instead.
member.param: The name of the property to register
The type of the property to register
The type that owns the new DependencyProperty
member.returns: The new DependencyProperty

member.name: M:SnapStream.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,SnapStream.PropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers an attached property.
member.remarks: In order for attached properties to be found by the parser the type must declare a public static method that has the form void Set{name}( DependencyObject, {propertyType} ) and {propertyType} Get{name}( DependencyObject ). If these are not provided DependencyObject.SetValue or DependencyObject.GetValue are used instead.
member.param: The name of the property to register
The type of the property to register
The type that owns the new DependencyProperty
The metadata associated with this property
member.returns: The new DependencyProperty

member.name: M:SnapStream.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers an attached property.
member.remarks: In order for attached properties to be found by the parser the type must declare a public static method that has the form void Set{name}( DependencyObject, {propertyType} ) and {propertyType} Get{name}( DependencyObject ). If these are not provided DependencyObject.SetValue or DependencyObject.GetValue are used instead.
member.param: The name of the property to register
The type of the property to register
The type that owns the new DependencyProperty
The defaultValue for this property
member.returns: The new DependencyProperty

member.name: M:SnapStream.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,SnapStream.PropertyMetadata,SnapStream.ValidateValueCallback)
member.summary: Registers an attached property.
member.remarks: In order for attached properties to be found by the parser the type must declare a public static method that has the form void Set{name}( DependencyObject, {propertyType} ) and {propertyType} Get{name}( DependencyObject ). If these are not provided DependencyObject.SetValue or DependencyObject.GetValue are used instead.
member.param: The name of the property to register
The type of the property to register
The type that owns the new DependencyProperty
The metadata associated with this property
The callback that should be invoked for validation
member.returns: The new DependencyProperty

member.summary: IAddChild provides a generic way for the parser to add items to an object. Implement this interface when you can have children and want those to be accesible to the parser

member.summary: Adds a child to the object implementing this interface. In your implementation of this method you can use the object's type to determine the appropriate action to take.
member.param: the object to add

member.name: M:SnapStream.Serialization.IAddChild.AddText(System.String)
member.summary: Adds textual content to the object implementing this interface. Most objects will not have textual content but those that do will get a notification every time new text is encountered which allows for complex flow based rendering of text in those objects where text and content can be freely mixed

member.name: T:SnapStream.Commands.Command
member.summary: Provides a way for components to interact by firing commands.
member.remarks: Commands are a very useful pattern for decoupling the handling of an action from the initiating of an action. Neither side of the interaction needs to know about the other.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Commands.Command._name
member.summary: The name of the Command

member.name: M:SnapStream.Commands.Command.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Command class.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Commands.Command.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Command class.
member.remarks: It is a good idea to ensure the uniqueness of command names by prefixing the name of a command with some company or developer specific string. The namespace for commands is shared and may not be partitioned using any other means. A command published by SnapStream may look something like "SnapStream.Commands.OpenVideoFile" for instance. Commands that are more generic do not need a namespace prefix.
member.param: The name of the command

member.name: M:SnapStream.Commands.Command.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of this Command.
member.returns: The name of this Command.

member.summary: Fires this Command.
member.remarks: Any command handler that has subscribed to the Execute event will be invoked by this method.

member.summary: Fires this Command.
member.remarks: Any command handler that has subscribed to the Execute event will be invoked by this method.
member.param: The arguments to pass to the Command

member.name: T:SnapStream.Menus.MenuItemTypeAttribute
member.summary: Provides an attribute for specifying the type of a menu's items.
member.remarks: This attribute should be used on a class that represents a concrete instance of a menu. The MenuItem, and Menu classes describe the attributes of an abstract menu (i.e. they describe properties that all menus will have in common). It is up to the class that provides a concrete representation of the menu to actually create items that use those abstract descriptions. This attribute specifies how that mapping should take place. The MenuManager class uses this attribute when it tries to create a concrete menu object from the abstract representation provided by these two classes.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Serialization.ILoaded
member.summary: ILoaded provides a way for the parser to notify an object that it is done parsing it and will not be used again by the parser. This method is called after the object that implements this interface has been added to the parent, but not before that parent object has been added to its parent object, so any relationship between this object and its ancestors will not be available.

member.name: P:SnapStream.Serialization.XamlProcessingInstructionNode.Target
member.summary: Gets the target of the processing instruction.
member.remarks: The target is the name immediately following the start of a processing instruction declaration. So in the processing instruction <?Mapping XmlNamespace='...' ?> the target would be "Mapping".

member.name: P:SnapStream.Serialization.XamlProcessingInstructionNode.Content
member.summary: Gets the content of the processing instruction.
member.remarks: The content is the data immediately following the target of a processing instruction declaration. So in the processing instruction <?Mapping XmlNamespace='...' ?> the content would be "XmlNamespace='...'".

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE
member.summary: Commonly used control types for specifying MIXERCONTROL.dwControlType

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.CUSTOM
member.summary: A generic mixer control

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.BOOLEANMETER
member.summary: Measures whether an integer value is FALSE/OFF (zero) or TRUE/ON (nonzero).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.SIGNEDMETER
member.summary: Measures integer values in the range of - 231 through (231 - 1). The mixer driver defines the limits of this meter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.PEAKMETER
member.summary: Measures the deflection from 0 in both the positive and negative directions. The range of integer values for the peak meter is - 32,768 through 32,767.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.UNSIGNEDMETER
member.summary: Measures integer values in the range of 0 through (232 - 1). The mixer driver defines the limits of this meter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.BOOLEAN
member.summary: The generic switch. It can be set to TRUE or FALSE.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.ONOFF
member.summary: An alternative switch that is represented by a graphic other than the one used for the Boolean switch. It can be set to ON or OFF.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MUTE
member.summary: Mutes an audio line (suppressing the data flow of the line) or allows the audio data to play. This switch is frequently used to help control the lines feeding into the mixer.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MONO
member.summary: Switches between mono and stereo output for a stereo audio line. Set to OFF to play stereo data as separate channels. Set to ON to combine data from both channels into a mono audio line.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.LOUDNESS
member.summary: Boosts low-volume bass for an audio line. Set to ON to boost low-volume bass. Set to OFF to set volume levels to normal. The amount of boost is hardware specific. For more information, see the documentation for your mixer device.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.STEREOENH
member.summary: Increases stereo separation. Set to ON to increase stereo separation. Set to OFF for no enhancement.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.BUTTON
member.summary: Set to TRUE for all buttons that the driver should handle as though they had been pressed. If the value is FALSE, no action is taken.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.DECIBELS
member.summary: Allows integer decibel values to be entered, in tenths of decibels. The range of values for this control is - 32,768 through 32,767.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.SIGNED
member.summary: Allows integer values entered in the range of - 231 through (231 - 1).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.UNSIGNED
member.summary: Allows integer values entered in the range of 0 through (232 - 1).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.PERCENT
member.summary: Allows values to be entered as percentages.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.SLIDER
member.summary: Has a range of - 32,768 through 32,767. The mixer driver defines the limits of this control.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.PAN
member.summary: Has a range of -32,768 through 32,767. The mixer driver defines the limits of this control, with 0 as the midrange value.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.QSOUNDPAN
member.summary: Provides expanded sound control through QSound. This control has a range of -15 through 15.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.FADER
member.summary: General fade control. The range of acceptable values is 0 through 65,535.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.VOLUME
member.summary: General volume fade control. The range of acceptable values is 0 through 65,535. For information about changing this range, see the documentation for your mixer device.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.BASS
member.summary: Bass volume fade control. The range of acceptable values is 0 through 65,535. The limits of the bass frequency band are hardware specific. For information about band limits, see the documentation for your mixer device.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.TREBLE
member.summary: Treble volume fade control. The range of acceptable values is 0 through 65,535. The limits of the treble frequency band are hardware specific. For information about the band limits, see the documentation for your mixer device.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.EQUALIZER
member.summary: Graphic equalizer control. The range of acceptable values for one band of the equalizer is 0 through 65,535. The number of equalizer bands and their limits are hardware specific. For information about the equalizer, see the documentation for your mixer device. You can use the MIXERCONTROLDETAILS_LISTTEXT structure to retrieve text labels for the equalizer.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.SINGLESELECT
member.summary: Restricts the control selection to one item at a time. Unlike the multiplexer control, this control can be used to control more than audio source lines. For example, you could use this control to select a low-pass filter from a list of filters supported by a mixer device.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MUX
member.summary: Restricts the line selection to one source line at a time.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MULTIPLESELECT
member.summary: Allows the user to select multiple items from a list simultaneously. Unlike the mixer control, the multiple-select control can be used to control more than audio source lines.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MIXER
member.summary: Allows the user to select source lines from a list simultaneously.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MICROTIME
member.summary: Supports timing data expressed in microseconds. The range of acceptable values is 0 through (232 -1).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERCONTROL_CONTROLTYPE.MILLITIME
member.summary: Supports timing data expressed in milliseconds. The range of acceptable values is 0 through (232 -1).

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE
member.summary: Defines constants used in the dwComponentType field of the MIXERLINE structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_DIGITAL
member.summary: Audio line is a digital destination (for example, digital input to a DAT or CD audio device).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_HEADPHONES
member.summary: Audio line is an adjustable (gain and/or attenuation) destination intended to drive headphones. Most audio cards use the same audio destination line for speakers and headphones, in which case the mixer device simply uses the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS type.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_LINE
member.summary: Audio line is a line level destination (for example, line level input from a CD audio device) that will be the final recording source for the analog-to-digital converter (ADC). Because most audio cards for personal computers provide some sort of gain for the recording audio source line, the mixer device will use the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN type.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_MONITOR
member.summary: Audio line is a destination used for a monitor.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_SPEAKERS
member.summary: Audio line is an adjustable (gain and/or attenuation) destination intended to drive speakers. This is the typical component type for the audio output of audio cards for personal computers.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_TELEPHONE
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that will be routed to a telephone line.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that cannot be defined by one of the standard component types. A mixer device is required to use this component type for line component types that have not been defined by Microsoft Corporation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_VOICEIN
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that will be the final recording source for voice input. This component type is exactly like MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN but is intended specifically for settings used during voice recording/recognition. Support for this line is optional for a mixer device. Many mixer devices provide only MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.DST_WAVEIN
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that will be the final recording source for the waveform-audio input (ADC). This line typically provides some sort of gain or attenuation. This is the typical component type for the recording line of most audio cards for personal computers.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_ANALOG
member.summary: Audio line is an analog source (for example, analog output from a video-cassette tape).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_AUXILIARY
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the auxiliary audio line. This line type is intended as a source with gain or attenuation that can be routed to the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS destination and/or recorded from the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN destination.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_COMPACTDISC
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the output of an internal audio CD. This component type is provided for audio cards that provide an audio source line intended to be connected to an audio CD (or CD-ROM playing an audio CD).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_DIGITAL
member.summary: Audio line is a digital source (for example, digital output from a DAT or audio CD).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_LINE
member.summary: Audio line is a line-level source (for example, line-level input from an external stereo) that can be used as an optional recording source. Because most audio cards for personal computers provide some sort of gain for the recording source line, the mixer device will use the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_AUXILIARY type.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_MICROPHONE
member.summary: Audio line is a microphone recording source. Most audio cards for personal computers provide at least two types of recording sources: an auxiliary audio line and microphone input. A microphone audio line typically provides some sort of gain. Audio cards that use a single input for use with a microphone or auxiliary audio line should use the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_MICROPHONE component type.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_PCSPEAKER
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from personal computer speaker. Several audio cards for personal computers provide the ability to mix what would typically be played on the internal speaker with the output of an audio card. Some audio cards support the ability to use this output as a recording source.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_SYNTHESIZER
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the output of an internal synthesizer. Most audio cards for personal computers provide some sort of MIDI synthesizer (for example, an Adlib-compatible or OPL/3 FM synthesizer).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_TELEPHONE
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from an incoming telephone line.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Audio line is a source that cannot be defined by one of the standard component types. A mixer device is required to use this component type for line component types that have not been defined by Microsoft Corporation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE.SRC_WAVEOUT
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the waveform-audio output digital-to-analog converter (DAC). Most audio cards for personal computers provide this component type as a source to the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS destination. Some cards also allow this source to be routed to the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN destination.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF
member.summary: Defines flags for fdwInfo in mixerGetLineInfo that specify how the line to be queried is specified

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF.DESTINATION
member.summary: The pmxl parameter will receive information about the destination audio line specified by the dwDestination member of the MIXERLINE structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF.SOURCE
member.summary: The pmxl parameter will receive information about the source audio line specified by the dwDestination and dwSource members of the MIXERLINE structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF.LINEID
member.summary: The pmxl parameter will receive information about the audio line specified by the dwLineID member of the MIXERLINE structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF.COMPONENTTYPE
member.summary: The pmxl parameter will receive information about the first audio line of the type specified in the dwComponentType member of the MIXERLINE structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF.TARGETTYPE
member.summary: The pmxl parameter will receive information about the audio line that is for the dwType member of the Target structure, which is a member of the MIXERLINE structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINEINFOF.QUERYMASK
member.summary: Masks the portion of fdwInfo that specifies how the line to be queried is specified

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINECONTROLSF
member.summary: Defines flags for fdwControls in mixerGetLineControls that specify how the line control to be queried is specified

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINECONTROLSF.ALL
member.summary: The pmxlc parameter references a list of MIXERCONTROL structures that will receive information on all controls associated with the audio line identified by the dwLineID member of the MIXERLINECONTROLS structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINECONTROLSF.ONEBYID
member.summary: The pmxlc parameter references a single MIXERCONTROL structure that will receive information on the control identified by the dwControlID member of the MIXERLINECONTROLS structure

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINECONTROLSF.ONEBYTYPE
member.summary: The mixerGetLineControls function retrieves information about the first control of a specific class for the audio line that is being queried

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETLINECONTROLSF.QUERYMASK
member.summary: Masks the portion of fdwControls that specifies how the line to be queried is specified

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETCONTROLDETAILSF
member.summary: Defines flags for fdwDetails in mixerGetControlDetails that specify how the line control to be queried is specified

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETCONTROLDETAILSF.VALUE
member.summary: Current values for a control are retrieved

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETCONTROLDETAILSF.LISTTEXT
member.summary: The paDetails member of the MIXERCONTROLDETAILS structure points to one or more MIXERCONTROLDETAILS_LISTTEXT structures to receive text labels for multiple-item controls

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_GETCONTROLDETAILSF.QUERYMASK
member.summary: Masks the portion of fdwDetails that specifies how the line control to be queried is specified

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_SETCONTROLDETAILSF
member.summary: Defines flags for fdwDetails in mixerSetControlDetails that specify how the line control to be set is specified

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_SETCONTROLDETAILSF.VALUE
member.summary: The current value(s) for a control are set

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_SETCONTROLDETAILSF.CUSTOM
member.summary: A custom dialog box for the specified custom mixer control is displayed

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_SETCONTROLDETAILSF.QUERYMASK
member.summary: Masks the portion of fdwDetails that specifies how the line control to be set is specified

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF
member.summary: Defines flags for several Windows Multimedia methods that specify an object as a handle. For example: mixerGetLineInfo.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.HANDLE
member.summary: Masks the portion of fdwInfo that specifies what the handle refers to

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.MIXER
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is a mixer device identifier in the range of zero to one less than the number of devices returned by the mixerGetNumDevs function. This flag is optional.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.HMIXER
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is a mixer device handle returned by the mixerOpen function. This flag is optional.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.WAVEOUT
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is the identifier of a waveform-audio output device in the range of zero to one less than the number of devices returned by the waveOutGetNumDevs function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.HWAVEOUT
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is a waveform-audio output handle returned by the waveOutOpen function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.WAVEIN
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is the identifier of a waveform-audio input device in the range of zero to one less than the number of devices returned by the waveInGetNumDevs function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.HWAVEIN
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is a waveform-audio input handle returned by the waveInOpen function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.MIDIOUT
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is the identifier of a MIDI output device. This identifier must be in the range of zero to one less than the number of devices returned by the midiOutGetNumDevs function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.HMIDIOUT
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is the handle of a MIDI output device. This handle must have been returned by the midiOutOpen function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.MIDIIN
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is the identifier of a MIDI input device. This identifier must be in the range of zero to one less than the number of devices returned by the midiInGetNumDevs function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.HMIDIIN
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is the handle of a MIDI input device. This handle must have been returned by the midiInOpen function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MIXER_OBJECTF.AUX
member.summary: The hmxobj parameter is an auxiliary device identifier in the range of zero to one less than the number of devices returned by the auxGetNumDevs function.

member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows. The window maintains its topmost position even when it is deactivated.

member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.
