member.summary: Synchronous playback of a sound event. PlaySound returns after the sound event completes.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.ASYNC
member.summary: The sound is played asynchronously and PlaySound returns immediately after beginning the sound. To terminate an asynchronously played waveform sound, call PlaySound with pszSound set to NULL.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.NODEFAULT
member.summary: No default sound event is used. If the sound cannot be found, PlaySound returns silently without playing the default sound.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.MEMORY
member.summary: A sound event's file is loaded in RAM. The parameter specified by pszSound must point to an image of a sound in memory.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.LOOP
member.summary: The sound plays repeatedly until PlaySound is called again with the pszSound parameter set to NULL. You must also specify the SND_ASYNC flag to indicate an asynchronous sound event.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.NOSTOP
member.summary: The specified sound event will yield to another sound event that is already playing. If a sound cannot be played because the resource needed to generate that sound is busy playing another sound, the function immediately returns FALSE without playing the requested sound.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.PURGE
member.summary: Sounds are to be stopped for the calling task. If pszSound is not NULL, all instances of the specified sound are stopped. If pszSound is NULL, all sounds that are playing on behalf of the calling task are stopped.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.APPLICATION
member.summary: The sound is played using an application-specific association.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.NOWAIT
member.summary: If the driver is busy, return immediately without playing the sound.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.ALIAS
member.summary: The pszSound parameter is a system-event alias in the registry or the WIN.INI file. Do not use with either SND_FILENAME or SND_RESOURCE.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.ALIAS_ID
member.summary: The pszSound parameter is a predefined sound identifier.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.FILENAME
member.summary: The pszSound parameter is a filename.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SND.RESOURCE
member.summary: The pszSound parameter is a resource identifier; hmod must identify the instance that contains the resource.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.WS
member.summary: Defines the Window Styles used in window creation methods like CreateWindowEx

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use EnableWindow.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.ICONIC
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially maximized.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the WS_OVERLAPPED, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, and WS_MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the WS_TILEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window with WS_BORDER, WS_POPUP, and WS_SYSMENU styles. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.SIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.TILED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the WS_OVERLAPPED, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, and WS_MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Creates a layered window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_LEFT
member.summary: Creates a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE and WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE, WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW, and WS_EX_TOPMOST styles.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WS.EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.GWL
member.summary: Defines indices used to retrieve data about a window in a call to GetWindowLong

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.WNDPROC
member.summary: Retrieves the address of the window procedure, or a handle representing the address of the window procedure. You must use the CallWindowProc function to call the window procedure.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.HINSTANCE
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the application instance.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.HWNDPARENT
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the parent window, if any.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.STYLE
member.summary: Retrieves the window styles.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.EXSTYLE
member.summary: Retrieves the extended window styles.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.USERDATA
member.summary: Retrieves the user data associated with the window. This data is intended for use by the application that created the window. Its value is initially zero.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.GWL.ID
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the window.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.WM
member.summary: Defines a subset of the Windows Message constants used to handle messages in Window Procedures

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NULL
member.summary: The WM_NULL message performs no operation. An application sends the WM_NULL message if it wants to post a message that the recipient window will ignore.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CREATE
member.summary: The WM_CREATE message is sent when an application requests that a window be created by calling the CreateWindowEx or CreateWindow function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DESTROY
member.summary: The WM_DESTROY message is sent when a window is being destroyed. It is sent to the window procedure of the window being destroyed after the window is removed from the screen.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOVE message is sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SIZE
member.summary: The WM_SIZE message is sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATE message is sent to both the window being activated and the window being deactivated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_SETFOCUS message is sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.KILLFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_KILLFOCUS message is sent to a window immediately before it loses the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ENABLE
member.summary: The WM_ENABLE message is sent when an application changes the enabled state of a window. It is sent to the window whose enabled state is changing.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETREDRAW message to a window to allow changes in that window to be redrawn or to prevent changes in that window from being redrawn.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETTEXT message to set the text of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXT message to copy the text that corresponds to a window into a buffer provided by the caller.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETTEXTLENGTH
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXTLENGTH message to determine the length, in characters, of the text associated with a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PAINT
member.summary: The WM_PAINT message is sent when the system or another application makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CLOSE
member.summary: The WM_CLOSE message is sent as a signal that a window or an application should terminate.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUERYENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_QUERYENDSESSION message is sent when the user chooses to end the session or when an application calls the ExitWindows function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUIT
member.summary: The WM_QUIT message indicates a request to terminate an application and is generated when the application calls the PostQuitMessage function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUERYOPEN
member.summary: The WM_QUERYOPEN message is sent to an icon when the user requests that the window be restored to its previous size and position.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ERASEBKGND
member.summary: The WM_ERASEBKGND message is sent when the window background must be erased (for example, when a window is resized).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SYSCOLORCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows when a change is made to a system color setting.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_ENDSESSION message is sent to an application after the system processes the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: The WM_SHOWWINDOW message is sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.WININICHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DEVMODECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVMODECHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows whenever the user changes device-mode settings.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ACTIVATEAPP
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATEAPP message is sent when a window belonging to a different application than the active window is about to be activated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.FONTCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_FONTCHANGE message to all top-level windows in the system after changing the pool of font resources.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.TIMECHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_TIMECHANGE message whenever it updates the system time.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CANCELMODE
member.summary: The WM_CANCELMODE message is sent to cancel certain modes, such as mouse capture.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETCURSOR
member.summary: The WM_SETCURSOR message is sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSEACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEACTIVATE message is sent when the cursor is in an inactive window and the user presses a mouse button.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CHILDACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_CHILDACTIVATE message is sent to a child window when the user clicks the window's title bar or when the window is activated, moved, or sized.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUEUESYNC
member.summary: The WM_QUEUESYNC message is sent by a computer-based training (CBT) application to separate user-input messages from other messages sent through the WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK Hook procedure.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: The WM_GETMINMAXINFO message is sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PAINTICON
member.summary: The WM_PAINTICON message is sent to a minimized window when the icon is to be painted.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ICONERASEBKGND
member.summary: The WM_ICONERASEBKGND message is sent to a minimized window when the background of the icon must be filled before painting the icon.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NEXTDLGCTL
member.summary: The WM_NEXTDLGCTL message is sent to a dialog box procedure to set the keyboard focus to a different control in the dialog box.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SPOOLERSTATUS
member.summary: The WM_SPOOLERSTATUS message is sent from Print Manager whenever a job is added to or removed from the Print Manager queue.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DRAWITEM
member.summary: The WM_DRAWITEM message is sent to the parent window of an owner-drawn button, combo box, list box, or menu when a visual aspect of the button, combo box, list box, or menu has changed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MEASUREITEM
member.summary: The WM_MEASUREITEM message is sent to the owner window of a combo box, list box, list view control, or menu item when the control or menu is created.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DELETEITEM
member.summary: The WM_DELETEITEM message is sent to the owner of a list box or combo box when the list box or combo box is destroyed or when items are removed by the LB_DELETESTRING, LB_RESETCONTENT, CB_DELETESTRING, or CB_RESETCONTENT message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.VKEYTOITEM
member.summary: The WM_VKEYTOITEM message is sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CHARTOITEM
member.summary: The WM_CHARTOITEM message is sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_CHAR message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETFONT message to specify the font that a control is to use when drawing text.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETFONT message to a control to retrieve the font with which the control is currently drawing its text.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETHOTKEY message to a window to associate a hot key with the window. When the user presses the hot key, the system activates the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETHOTKEY message to determine the hot key associated with a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUERYDRAGICON
member.summary: The WM_QUERYDRAGICON message is sent to a minimized (iconic) window. The window is about to be dragged by the user but does not have an icon defined for its class.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.COMPAREITEM
member.summary: The system sends the WM_COMPAREITEM message to determine the relative position of a new item in the sorted list of an owner-drawn combo box or list box.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.COMPACTING
member.summary: The WM_COMPACTING message is sent to all top-level windows when the system detects more than 12.5 percent of system time over a 30- to 60-second interval is being spent compacting memory. This indicates that system memory is low.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.COMMNOTIFY
member.summary: No longer supported: WM_COMMNOTIFY

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.POWER
member.summary: The WM_POWER message is broadcast when the system, typically a battery-powered personal computer, is about to enter suspended mode.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.COPYDATA
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPYDATA message to pass data to another application.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CANCELJOURNAL
member.summary: The WM_CANCELJOURNAL message is posted to an application when a user cancels the application's journaling activities.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_NOTIFY message is sent by a common control to its parent window when an event has occurred or the control requires some information.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message is posted to the window with the focus when the user chooses a new input language, either with the hotkey (specified in the Keyboard control panel application) or from the indicator on the system taskbar.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.INPUTLANGCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE message is sent to the topmost affected window after an application's input language has been changed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.TCARD
member.summary: Sent to an application that has initiated a training card with Microsoft Windows Help.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.HELP
member.summary: Indicates that the user pressed the F1 key.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.USERCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_USERCHANGED message is sent to all windows after the user has logged on or off.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NOTIFYFORMAT
member.summary: Used to determine if a window accepts ANSI or Unicode structures in the WM_NOTIFY notification message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CONTEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_CONTEXTMENU message notifies a window that the user clicked the right mouse button (right-clicked) in the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.STYLECHANGING
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGING message is sent to a window when the SetWindowLong function is about to change one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.STYLECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGED message is sent to a window after the SetWindowLong function has changed one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DISPLAYCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DISPLAYCHANGE message is sent to all windows when the display resolution has changed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETICON
member.summary: The WM_GETICON message is sent to a window to retrieve a handle to the large or small icon associated with a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SETICON
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETICON message to associate a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCCREATE
member.summary: The WM_NCCREATE message is sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCDESTROY
member.summary: The WM_NCDESTROY message informs a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: The WM_NCCALCSIZE message is sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCHITTEST
member.summary: The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or when a mouse button is pressed or released.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_NCPAINT message is sent to a window when its frame must be painted.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_NCACTIVATE message is sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.GETDLGCODE
F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCMOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor is moved within the nonclient area of the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCLBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCLBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCLBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCRBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCRBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCMBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCMBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NCMBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.KEYFIRST
member.summary: Signifies the first keyboard-related input msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CHAR
member.summary: The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_DEADCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYUP message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. A dead key is a key that generates a character, such as the umlaut (double-dot), that is combined with another character to form a composite character.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SYSCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SYSDEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSDEADCHAR message is sent to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.KEYLAST
member.summary: Signifies the last keyboard-related input msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_STARTCOMPOSITION
member.summary: The WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION message is sent immediately before the IME generates the composition string as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_ENDCOMPOSITION
member.summary: The WM_IME_ENDCOMPOSITION message is sent to an application when the IME ends composition.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_COMPOSITION
member.summary: The WM_IME_COMPOSITION message is sent to an application when the IME changes composition status as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_KEYLAST
member.summary: Signifies the last keyboard-related input msg (when including IME composition)

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.INITDIALOG
member.summary: The WM_INITDIALOG message is sent to the dialog box procedure immediately before a dialog box is displayed. Dialog box procedures typically use this message to initialize controls and carry out any other initialization tasks that affect the appearance of the dialog box.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.COMMAND
member.summary: The WM_COMMAND message is sent when the user selects a command item from a menu, when a control sends a notification message to its parent window, or when an accelerator keystroke is translated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives the WM_SYSCOMMAND message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.TIMER
member.summary: The WM_TIMER message is posted to the installing thread's message queue when a timer expires.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.HSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.VSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.INITMENU
member.summary: The WM_INITMENU message is sent when a menu is about to become active. It occurs when the user clicks an item on the menu bar or presses a menu key.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.INITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: The WM_INITMENUPOPUP message is sent when a drop-down menu or submenu is about to become active.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MENUSELECT
member.summary: The WM_MENUSELECT message is sent to a menu's owner window when the user selects a menu item.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MENUCHAR
member.summary: The WM_MENUCHAR message is sent when a menu is active and the user presses a key that does not correspond to any mnemonic or accelerator key.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ENTERIDLE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERIDLE message is sent to the owner window of a modal dialog box or menu that is entering an idle state.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUERYUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_QUERYUISTATE message to retrieve the user interface (UI) state for a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLORMSGBOX
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORMSGBOX message is sent to the owner window of a message box before Windows draws the message box.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLOREDIT
member.summary: An edit control that is not read-only or disabled sends the WM_CTLCOLOREDIT message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLORLISTBOX
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORLISTBOX message is sent to the parent window of a list box before the system draws the list box.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLORBTN
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORBTN message is sent to the parent window of a button before drawing the button.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLORDLG
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORDLG message is sent to a dialog box before the system draws the dialog box.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR message is sent to the parent window of a scroll bar control when the control is about to be drawn.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CTLCOLORSTATIC
member.summary: A static control, or an edit control that is read-only or disabled, sends the WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSEFIRST
member.summary: Signifies the first mouse-related input msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor moves.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.LBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.LBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.RBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEWHEEL message is sent to the focus window when the mouse wheel is rotated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSELAST
member.summary: Signifies the last mouse-related input msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_PARENTNOTIFY message is sent to the parent of a child window when the child window is created or destroyed, or when the user clicks a mouse button while the cursor is over the child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ENTERMENULOOP
member.summary: The WM_ENTERMENULOOP message informs an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been entered.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.EXITMENULOOP
member.summary: The WM_EXITMENULOOP message informs an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been exited.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.NEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_NEXTMENU message is sent to an application when the right or left arrow key is used to switch between the menu bar and the system menu.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SIZING
member.summary: The WM_SIZING message is sent to a window that the user is resizing.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CAPTURECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_CAPTURECHANGED message is sent to the window that is losing the mouse capture.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOVING
member.summary: The WM_MOVING message is sent to a window that the user is moving.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.POWERBROADCAST
member.summary: The WM_POWERBROADCAST message is broadcast to an application to notify it of power-management events.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DEVICECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVICECHANGE device message notifies an application of a change to the hardware configuration of a device or the computer.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_SETCONTEXT
member.summary: The WM_IME_SETCONTEXT message is sent to an application when a window of the application is activated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_NOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_IME_NOTIFY message is sent to an application to notify it of changes to the IME window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_CONTROL
member.summary: The WM_IME_CONTROL message directs the IME window to carry out the requested command.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_COMPOSITIONFULL
member.summary: The WM_IME_COMPOSITIONFULL message is sent to an application when the IME window finds no space to extend the area for the composition window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_SELECT
member.summary: The WM_IME_SELECT message is sent to an application when the system is about to change the current IME.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_CHAR
member.summary: The WM_IME_CHAR message is sent to an application when the IME gets a character of the conversion result.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_IME_KEYDOWN message is sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key press.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.IME_KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_IME_KEYUP message is sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key release.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDICREATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICREATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to create an MDI child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIDESTROY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIDESTROY message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to close an MDI child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIACTIVATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIACTIVATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to instruct the client window to activate a different MDI child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIRESTORE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIRESTORE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to restore an MDI child window from maximized or minimized size.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDINEXT
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDINEXT message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to activate the next or previous child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIMAXIMIZE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIMAXIMIZE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to maximize an MDI child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDITILE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDITILE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all of its MDI child windows in a tile format.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDICASCADE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICASCADE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all its child windows in a cascade format.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIICONARRANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIICONARRANGE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all minimized MDI child windows.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIGETACTIVE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIGETACTIVE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to retrieve the handle to the active MDI child window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDISETMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDISETMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to replace the entire menu of an MDI frame window, to replace the window menu of the frame window, or both.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ENTERSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window after it enters the moving or sizing modal loop.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.EXITSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_EXITSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window, after it has exited the moving or sizing modal loop.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DROPFILES
member.summary: Sent when the user drops a file on the window of an application that has registered itself as a recipient of dropped files.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MDIREFRESHMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIREFRESHMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to refresh the window menu of the MDI frame window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSEHOVER
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEHOVER message is posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the client area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.MOUSELEAVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSELEAVE message is posted to a window when the cursor leaves the client area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CUT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CUT message to an edit control or combo box to delete (cut) the current selection, if any, in the edit control and copy the deleted text to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.COPY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPY message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current selection to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PASTE
member.summary: An application sends a WM_PASTE message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current content of the clipboard to the edit control at the current caret position. Data is inserted only if the clipboard contains data in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CLEAR
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CLEAR message to an edit control or combo box to delete (clear) the current selection, if any, from the edit control.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.UNDO
member.summary: An application sends a WM_UNDO message to an edit control to undo the last operation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.RENDERFORMAT
member.summary: The WM_RENDERFORMAT message is sent to the clipboard owner if it has delayed rendering a specific clipboard format and if an application has requested data in that format. The clipboard owner must render data in the specified format and place it on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.RENDERALLFORMATS
member.summary: The WM_RENDERALLFORMATS message is sent to the clipboard owner before it is destroyed, if the clipboard owner has delayed rendering one or more clipboard formats. For the content of the clipboard to remain available to other applications, the clipboard owner must render data in all the formats it is capable of generating, and place the data on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DESTROYCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner when a call to the EmptyClipboard function empties the clipboard.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.DRAWCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when the content of the clipboard changes. This enables a clipboard viewer window to display the new content of the clipboard.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PAINTCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area needs repainting.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.VSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's vertical scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.SIZECLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_SIZECLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area has changed size.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.ASKCBFORMATNAME
member.summary: The WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window to request the name of a CF_OWNERDISPLAY clipboard format.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.CHANGECBCHAIN
member.summary: The WM_CHANGECBCHAIN message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when a window is being removed from the chain.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.HSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window. This occurs when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's horizontal scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.QUERYNEWPALETTE
member.summary: The WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE message informs a window that it is about to receive the keyboard focus, giving the window the opportunity to realize its logical palette when it receives the focus.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PALETTEISCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_PALETTEISCHANGING message informs applications that an application is going to realize its logical palette.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PALETTECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_PALETTECHANGED message is sent to all top-level and overlapped windows after the window with the keyboard focus has realized its logical palette, thereby changing the system palette.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.HOTKEY
member.summary: The WM_HOTKEY message is posted when the user presses a hot key registered by the RegisterHotKey function.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PRINT
member.summary: The WM_PRINT message is sent to a window to request that it draw itself in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PRINTCLIENT
member.summary: The WM_PRINTCLIENT message is sent to a window to request that it draw its client area in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.HANDHELDFIRST
member.summary: Specifies the first hand-held msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.HANDHELDLAST
member.summary: Specifies the last hand-held msg

member.summary: Specifies the first afx msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.AFXLAST
member.summary: Specifies the last afx msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PENWINFIRST
member.summary: Specifies the first penwin msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.PENWINLAST
member.summary: Specifies the last penwin msg

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WM.APP
member.summary: The WM_APP constant is used by applications to help define private messages, usually of the form WM_APP+X, where X is an integer value.

member.summary: Physical Height in device units

member.summary: Physical Printable Area x margin

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CAPS.PHYSICALOFFSETY
member.summary: Physical Printable Area y margin

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CAPS.SCALINGFACTORX

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.TPM
member.summary: Defines the flags used in calling TrackPopupMenuEx

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.LEFTBUTTON
member.summary: If this flag is set, the user can select menu items with only the left mouse button.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.RIGHTBUTTON
member.summary: If this flag is set, the user can select menu items with both the left and right mouse buttons.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.LEFTALIGN
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function positions the shortcut menu so that its left side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.CENTERALIGN
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function centers the shortcut menu horizontally relative to the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.RIGHTALIGN
member.summary: Positions the shortcut menu so that its right side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.TOPALIGN
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function positions the shortcut menu so that its top side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.VCENTERALIGN
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function centers the shortcut menu vertically relative to the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.BOTTOMALIGN
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function positions the shortcut menu so that its bottom side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.HORIZONTAL
member.summary: If the menu cannot be shown at the specified location without overlapping the excluded rectangle, the system tries to accommodate the requested horizontal alignment before the requested vertical alignment.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.VERTICAL
member.summary: If the menu cannot be shown at the specified location without overlapping the excluded rectangle, the system tries to accommodate the requested vertical alignment before the requested horizontal alignment.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.NONOTIFY
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function does not send notification messages when the user clicks on a menu item.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.RETURNCMD
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function returns the menu item identifier of the user's selection in the return value.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.RECURSE
member.summary: Use the TPM_RECURSE flag to display a menu when another menu is already displayed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.HORPOSANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from left to right.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.HORNEGANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from right to left.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.VERPOSANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from top to bottom.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.VERNEGANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from bottom to top.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.NOANIMATION
member.summary: Displays menu without animation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.TPM.LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: To have text layout from right-to-left, use TPM_LAYOUTRTL. By default, the text layout is left-to-right.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.SW
member.summary: Defines some commands to use when calling ShowWindow

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.NORMAL
member.summary: Same as SHOWNORMAL

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is hung. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SW.MAX
member.summary: Signifies the last value in this enum

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL
member.summary: CSIDL values provide a unique system-independent way to identify special folders used frequently by applications, but which may not have the same name or location on any given system.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.FLAG_CREATE
member.summary: Combine this CSIDL with any of the following CSIDLs to force the creation of the associated folder.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.ADMINTOOLS
F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.ALTSTARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's nonlocalized Startup program group.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.APPDATA
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data. This CSIDL is supported by the redistributable Shfolder.dll for systems that do not have the Microsoft Internet Explorer 4.0 integrated Shell installed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.BITBUCKET
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.CDBURN_AREA
member.summary: The file system directory acting as a staging area for files waiting to be written to CD. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\CD Burning.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_ADMINTOOLS
member.summary: The file system directory containing administrative tools for all users of the computer.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_ALTSTARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the nonlocalized Startup program group for all users. Valid only for Microsoft Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_APPDATA
member.summary: The file system directory containing application data for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_DESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: The file system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_DOCUMENTS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains documents that are common to all users. A typical paths is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents. Valid for Windows NT systems and Microsoft Windows 95 and Windows 98 systems with Shfolder.dll installed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_FAVORITES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for favorite items common to all users. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_MUSIC
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_PICTURES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_PROGRAMS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_STARTMENU
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs and folders that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_STARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_TEMPLATES
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Templates. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COMMON_VIDEO
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.CONTROLS
member.summary: The virtual folder containing icons for the Control Panel applications.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.COOKIES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Cookies.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.DESKTOP
member.summary: The virtual folder representing the Windows desktop, the root of the namespace.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.DESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop (not to be confused with the desktop folder itself). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Desktop.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.DRIVES
member.summary: The virtual folder representing My Computer, containing everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel. The folder may also contain mapped network drives.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.FAVORITES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorite items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Favorites.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.FONTS
member.summary: A virtual folder containing fonts. A typical path is C:\Windows\Fonts.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.HISTORY
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.INTERNET
member.summary: A virtual folder representing the Internet.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.INTERNET_CACHE
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.LOCAL_APPDATA
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a data repository for local (nonroaming) applications. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.MYDOCUMENTS
member.summary: The virtual folder representing the My Documents desktop item.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.MYMUSIC
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for music files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\User\My Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.MYPICTURES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for image files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.MYVIDEO
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for video files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.NETHOOD
member.summary: A file system directory containing the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder. It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\NetHood.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.NETWORK
member.summary: A virtual folder representing Network Neighborhood, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PERSONAL
member.summary: The virtual folder representing the My Documents desktop item. This is equivalent to CSIDL_MYDOCUMENTS.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PRINTERS
member.summary: The virtual folder containing installed printers.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PRINTHOOD
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\PrintHood.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PROFILE
member.summary: The user's profile folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username. Applications should not create files or folders at this level; they should put their data under the locations referred to by CSIDL_APPDATA or CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PROFILES
member.summary: The file system directory containing user profile folders. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PROGRAM_FILES
member.summary: The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PROGRAM_FILES_COMMON
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows NT, Windows 2000, and Windows XP systems. Not valid for Windows Millennium Edition (Windows Me).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.PROGRAMS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the user's program groups (which are themselves file system directories). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.RECENT
member.summary: The file system directory that contains shortcuts to the user's most recently used documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Recent Documents. To create a shortcut in this folder, use SHAddToRecentDocs. In addition to creating the shortcut, this function updates the Shell's list of recent documents and adds the shortcut to the My Recent Documents submenu of the Start menu.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.SENDTO
member.summary: The file system directory that contains Send To menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\SendTo.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.STARTMENU
member.summary: The file system directory containing Start menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.STARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group. The system starts these programs whenever any user logs onto Windows NT or starts Windows 95. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.SYSTEM
member.summary: The Windows System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.TEMPLATES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Templates.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.CSIDL.WINDOWS
member.summary: The Windows directory or SYSROOT. This corresponds to the %windir% or %SYSTEMROOT% environment variables. A typical path is C:\Windows.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.SWP
member.summary: Defines window sizing and positioning flags that can be used when calling SetWindowPos

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the size of the window is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the size of the window is being changed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the position in the Z order of the owner window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame, defined in the class description of the window, around the window.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SWP.ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.Helpers.Win32.SetSystemPowerState(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Platform Invokes SetSystemPowerState
member.param: If this parameter is TRUE, the system is suspended. If the parameter is FALSE, the system hibernates.

If this parameter is TRUE, the function broadcasts a PBT_APMSUSPEND event to each application and driver, then immediately suspends operation. If the parameter is FALSE, the function broadcasts a PBT_APMQUERYSUSPEND event to each application to request permission to suspend operation.
member.returns: If power has been suspended and subsequently restored, the return value is nonzero. If the system was not suspended, the return value is zero.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CANCOPY
member.summary: The specified items can be copied (same value as the DROPEFFECT_COPY flag).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CANMOVE
member.summary: The specified items can be moved (same value as the DROPEFFECT_MOVE flag).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CANLINK

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.STORAGE

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CANRENAME
member.summary: The specified items can be renamed.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CANDELETE

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.HASPROPSHEET

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.DROPTARGET

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CAPABILITYMASK
member.summary: Do not use.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.ENCRYPTED
member.summary: The item is encrypted and may require special presentation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.ISSLOW
member.summary: Indicates that accessing the object (through IStream or other storage interfaces) is a slow operation.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.GHOSTED
member.summary: The specified items should be displayed using a ghosted icon.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.LINK
member.summary: The specified items are shortcuts.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.SHARE
member.summary: The specified folder objects are shared.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.READONLY
member.summary: The specified items are read-only.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.HIDDEN
member.summary: The item is hidden and should not be displayed unless the Show hidden files and folders option is enabled in Folder Settings.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.DISPLAYATTRMASK
member.summary: Do not use.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.FILESYSANCESTOR
member.summary: The specified folder objects are either file system folders or have at least one descendant (child, grandchild, or later) that is a file system folder.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.FOLDER
member.summary: The specified items are folders.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.FILESYSTEM
member.summary: The specified items are part of the file system (that is, they are files, directories, or root directories).

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.HASSUBFOLDER

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CONTENTSMASK
member.summary: Do not use.

member.summary: The specified items can be browsed in place.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.NONENUMERATED
member.summary: The specified items are nonenumerated items.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.NEWCONTENT

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.CANMONIKER

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.HASSTORAGE

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.SFGAO.STREAM
member.summary: Indicates that the item has a stream associated with it that can be accessed by a call to IShellFolder::BindToObject with IID_IStream in the riid parameter.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.IShellFolder
member.summary: The IShellFolder interface is used to manage folders. It is exposed by all Shell namespace folder objects.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IShellFolder.ParseDisplayName(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Translates a file object's or folder's display name into an item identifier list.
member.param: Window handle.
Bind context that controls the parsing operation.
Null-terminated Unicode string with the display name.
Pointer to a ULONG value that receives the number of characters of the display name that was parsed.
Pointer to an ITEMIDLIST pointer that receives the item identifier list for the object.
Value used to query for file attributes.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IShellFolder.EnumObjects(System.IntPtr,SnapStream.Util.SHCONTF,SnapStream.Util.IEnumIDList@)
member.summary: Allows a client to determine the contents of a folder by creating an item identifier enumeration object and returning its IEnumIDList interface. The methods supported by that interface can then be used to enumerate the folder's contents.
member.param: If user input is required to perform the enumeration, this window handle should be used by the enumeration object as the parent window to take user input.
Flags indicating which items to include in the enumeration.
Address that receives a pointer to the IEnumIDList interface of the enumeration object created by this method.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise.

Address of an IBindCtx interface on a bind context object to be used during this operation.
Identifier of the interface to return.
Address that receives the interface pointer.

Interface identifier (IID) of the requested storage interface.
Address that receives the interface pointer specified by riid.

Pointer to the first item's ITEMIDLIST structure.

Reserved.

member.summary: Determines whether this instance of IMalloc was used to allocate the specified block of memory.
member.param: Pointer to the memory block; can be a NULL pointer, in which case, -1 is returned.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo
member.summary: The start menu is a tricky thing in Windows. It is essentially the combination of two different directory hierarchies (one for "All Users" and one for the "Current User") merged into one. This class handles the navigation multiple directories that need to be merged into one. If no arguments are passed to the constructor, the directories default to the StartMenu directories.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo._baseDirectories
member.summary: Contains the root directories that will be merged

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo._currentDirectories
member.summary: Contains the list of root directories appended with the current NavigatedPath

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo._currentItems
member.summary: Contains all of the sorted FileSystemInfos in the list of _currentDirectories

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo._excludedFilenames
member.summary: Contains the list of files that are not to be shown

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates a multi root file browser with 4 base directories and one excluded file 1. AllUsers\StartMenu 2. AllUsers\StartMenu\Programs 3. [CurrentUser]\StartMenu 4. [CurrentUser]\StartMenu\Programs
desktop.ini is excluded

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo.#ctor(System.IO.DirectoryInfo[],System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a multi root file browser with the given base directories and exclusions
member.param: List of DirectoryInfo objects that make up the base directories
List of files that will not be shown

member.param: Full path to parse
member.returns: Path after the base directory path (no leading '\')

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo.PopulateDefaultBaseDirectories

member.summary: Sets the directory back to the base directories

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.MultipleDirectoryInfo.NavigateUpOneLevel
member.summary: Sets the current directories to be pointing at their parents. If a base directory is reached, all base directories will be added. Note: Will not navigate above the base directories

member.summary: Determines if the given directory is a base directory
member.param: Directory to check
member.returns: True if the given directory is a base directory False otherwise

member.summary: Returns the first valid parent of a directory in the list of current directories Returns null if we are at the base directory
