member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA
member.summary: Emulates WIN32_FIND_DATAA

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.dwFileAttributes
member.summary: File attributes of the file found.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.ftCreationTime
member.summary: A FILETIME structure that specifies when the file or directory was created.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.ftLastAccessTime
member.summary: A FILETIME structure. For a file, the structure specifies when the file was last read from, written to, or, in the case of executable files, run. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory was created. If the underlying file system does not support last access time, this member is zero.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.ftLastWriteTime
member.summary: A FILETIME structure. For a file, the structure specifies when the file was last written to, truncated, or overwritten (for example, with WriteFile or SetEndOfFile). This date and time is not updated when file attributes or security descriptors are changed. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory was created. If the underlying file system does not support last write time, this member is zero.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.nFileSizeHigh
member.summary: High-order DWORD value of the file size, in bytes.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.nFileSizeLow
member.summary: Low-order DWORD value of the file size, in bytes.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.dwReserved0
member.summary: If the dwFileAttributes member includes the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_REPARSE_POINT attribute, this member specifies the reparse tag. Otherwise, this value is undefined and should not be used.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.dwReserved1
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.cFileName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAA.cAlternateFileName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that specifies an alternative name for the file. This name is in the classic 8.3 (filename.ext) file name format.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW
member.summary: Emulates WIN32_FIND_DATAW

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.dwFileAttributes
member.summary: File attributes of the file found.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.ftCreationTime
member.summary: A FILETIME structure that specifies when the file or directory was created.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.ftLastAccessTime
member.summary: A FILETIME structure. For a file, the structure specifies when the file was last read from, written to, or, in the case of executable files, run. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory was created. If the underlying file system does not support last access time, this member is zero.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.ftLastWriteTime
member.summary: A FILETIME structure. For a file, the structure specifies when the file was last written to, truncated, or overwritten (for example, with WriteFile or SetEndOfFile). This date and time is not updated when file attributes or security descriptors are changed. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory was created. If the underlying file system does not support last write time, this member is zero.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.nFileSizeHigh
member.summary: High-order DWORD value of the file size, in bytes.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.nFileSizeLow
member.summary: Low-order DWORD value of the file size, in bytes.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.dwReserved0
member.summary: If the dwFileAttributes member includes the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_REPARSE_POINT attribute, this member specifies the reparse tag. Otherwise, this value is undefined and should not be used.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.dwReserved1
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.cFileName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file.

member.name: F:SnapStream.Util.WIN32_FIND_DATAW.cAlternateFileName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that specifies an alternative name for the file. This name is in the classic 8.3 (filename.ext) file name format.

member.name: T:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile
member.summary: The IPersistFile interface provides methods that permit an object to be loaded from or saved to a disk file, rather than a storage object or stream.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile.GetClassID(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Returns the class identifier (CLSID) for the component object.
member.param: Points to the location of the CLSID on return.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile.IsDirty
member.summary: Checks an object for changes since it was last saved to its current file.
member.returns: S_OK: The object has changed since it was last saved. S_FALSE: The object has not changed since the last save.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile.Load(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens the specified file and initializes an object from the file contents.
member.param: Points to a zero-terminated string containing the absolute path of the file to open.
Specifies some combination of the values from the STGM enumeration to indicate the access mode to use when opening the file.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile.Save(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves a copy of the object into the specified file.
member.param: Points to a zero-terminated string containing the absolute path of the file to which the object should be saved.
Indicates whether the pszFileName parameter is to be used as the current working file.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile.SaveCompleted(System.String)
member.summary: Notifies the object that it can write to its file.
member.param: Points to the absolute path of the file where the object was previously saved.

member.name: M:SnapStream.Util.IPersistFile.GetCurFile(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves either the absolute path to the object's current working file or, if there is no current working file, the object's default filename prompt.
member.param: Points to the location of a pointer to a zero-terminated string containing the path for the current file or the default filename prompt (such as *.txt). If an error occurs, ppszFileName is set to NULL.
